Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label at least two types of habitats, one on land and one in water, showing different environments (e.g., playground, forest, pond, stream).
The student can illustrate and label a variety of living things in each habitat, such as plants and animals (e.g., trees, grasses, lizards, squirrels, fish).
The student can show patterns of diversity by comparing different types of living things found in each habitat, using labels or a legend.
The student can demonstrate observations by using details in their drawings, like shapes, colors, and sizes, to represent different plants and animals.
The student can organize their illustrations in a way that clearly shows the relationship between habitats and the living things that reside in them.
